question: Who was the first Roman emperor?
funFact: Augustus (originally Octavian) was the first Roman emperor, ruling from 27 BC to 14 AD. He was the adopted son of Julius Caesar.

question: Who was the second Roman emperor?
funFact: Tiberius was the second Roman emperor, ruling from 14 to 37 AD. He was the stepson of Augustus and was known for his reclusive nature.

question: Who was the third Roman emperor?
funFact: Caligula was the third Roman emperor, ruling from 37 to 41 AD. He was known for his cruelty and was assassinated by his own guards.

question: Who was the fourth Roman emperor?
funFact: Claudius was the fourth Roman emperor, ruling from 41 to 54 AD. He was considered weak and disabled but proved to be an effective ruler.

question: Who was the fifth Roman emperor?
funFact: Nero was the fifth Roman emperor, ruling from 54 to 68 AD. He was known for his extravagance and is said to have 'fiddled while Rome burned.'

question: Who was the 'Good Emperor'?
funFact: Trajan, Hadrian, and Marcus Aurelius are known as the 'Five Good Emperors' (along with Nerva and Antoninus Pius). They ruled during a period of stability and prosperity.

question: Who was the emperor who built Hadrian's Wall?
funFact: Hadrian built Hadrian's Wall in northern Britain (122-128 AD) to mark the northern boundary of the Roman Empire and protect against Scottish tribes.

question: Who was the philosopher emperor?
funFact: Marcus Aurelius was known as the philosopher emperor. He wrote 'Meditations,' a collection of personal reflections on Stoic philosophy.

question: Who was the emperor who divided the empire?
funFact: Diocletian divided the Roman Empire into Eastern and Western halves in 286 AD to make it easier to govern. This division became permanent.

question: Who was the first Christian emperor?
funFact: Constantine the Great was the first Roman emperor to convert to Christianity. He issued the Edict of Milan in 313 AD, legalizing Christianity.

question: Who was the last Western Roman emperor?
funFact: Romulus Augustulus is traditionally considered the last Western Roman emperor (deposed 476 AD), though Julius Nepos also claimed the title until 480 AD.

question: Who was the emperor who 'fiddled while Rome burned'?
funFact: Nero was the emperor during the Great Fire of Rome in 64 AD. The story that he 'fiddled while Rome burned' is likely a myth, as the fiddle didn't exist then.

question: Who was the emperor who made his horse a consul?
funFact: Caligula is said to have made his horse Incitatus a consul, though this may be exaggerated. He was known for his cruelty and eccentricity.

question: Who was the emperor who built the Colosseum?
funFact: Vespasian began construction of the Colosseum in 70 AD. It was completed by his son Titus in 80 AD and could hold up to 80,000 spectators.

question: Who was the emperor during the Year of the Four Emperors?
funFact: The Year of the Four Emperors (69 AD) saw Galba, Otho, Vitellius, and Vespasian all claim the throne. Vespasian emerged victorious and established the Flavian dynasty.

question: Who was the emperor who built the Pantheon?
funFact: Hadrian rebuilt the Pantheon in Rome (c. 126 AD). The original was built by Marcus Agrippa but was destroyed by fire.

question: Who was the emperor who legalized Christianity?
funFact: Constantine the Great legalized Christianity with the Edict of Milan in 313 AD. He later became the first Christian emperor.

question: Who was the emperor who made Christianity the official religion?
funFact: Theodosius I made Christianity the official religion of the Roman Empire in 380 AD. He also banned pagan practices.

question: Who was the longest-reigning Roman emperor?
funFact: Augustus had the longest reign of any Roman emperor, ruling for 41 years from 27 BC to 14 AD.

question: Who was the shortest-reigning Roman emperor?
funFact: Otho and Pertinax both had very short reigns. Otho ruled for 3 months in 69 AD, and Pertinax ruled for 3 months in 193 AD.
